document.heading: Adams Morgan Business Improvement District Temporary Amendment Act of 2021
To amend, on a temporary basis, the Business Improvement Districts Act of 1996 to establish the expiration date of the first term of the Adams Morgan BID.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Adams Morgan Business Improvement District Temporary Amendment Act of 2021".

section.text: Section 206 of the Business Improvement Districts Act of 1996, effective March 8, 2006 (D.C. Law 16-56; D.C. Official Code § 2-1215.56), is amended by adding a new subsection (a-1) to read as follows:

para.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law or order to the contrary, the initial term of the Adams Morgan BID began, pursuant to Mayor's Order 2005-121 dated August 22, 2005, on June 30, 2005 and expired on September 30, 2011.
This subsection shall apply as of January 1, 2010.

codify:insert.text: *NOTE: This section includes amendments by temporary legislation that will expire on December 24, 2021. To view the text of this section after the expiration of all emergency and temporary legislation effecting this section, click this link: Permanent Version.*

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code § 1-301.47a).

para.text: This act shall take effect following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code § 1-206.02(c)(1)), and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
This act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
